Transcript:


Guide: Welcome to Being Zoo. The zoo has many kinds of animals, such as bear, zebras, giraffes and pandas. They come from many different countries and they eat different food. Here are the lions.
Tony: Do lions eat meat?
Guide: Yes, they do. They eat other animals. Theyâ€™re dangerous!
Lingling: Ugh! And what about bears? Do they eat meat?
Guide: Yes, they do, but they also eat plants.
Tony: Look at this elephant. Itâ€™s very tall. Does it eat meat?
Guide: No, it doesnâ€™t. It eats plants.
Lingling: Do pandas eat plants?
Guide: Sure. They love bamboo.
Lingling: Are there pandas here? Theyâ€™re my favourite animals. Theyâ€™re cute. Shall we go and see them?
Guide: Yes, letâ€™s go. Can you see Lingling?
Tony: Sheâ€™s in front of you!
Guide: No, Lingling the panda!
Lingling: Which is Lingling the panda?
Guide: Sheâ€™s the black and white animal over there. Look! There she is!
Lingling: Thatâ€™s very funny. Her name is Lingling too!
Tony: Is there a panda called Tonyâ€¦?

The elephant lives in Africa and in Asia. This elephant lives in Africa. It eats plants and a little fruit, but it doesnâ€™t eat meat. It likes water. 


There are only about 1,800 pandas in China and about 200 of them live in zoos. The panda eats about 30 kilos of bamboo a day, as well as other plants. This black and white animal is the favourite of people all over the world.


The zebra is an African animal. Like the panda, itâ€™s black and white. It eats plants and leaves, as well as grass, but the zebra doesnâ€™t eat bamboo. 


The tiger lives in Asia. It usually lives alone. It likes water and is good at swimming. Itâ€™s strong and catches /kÃ¦tÊƒÉªz/ ï¼ˆv. æŠ“ï¼‰ many kinds of animals for food.


Monkeys live in Africa, Asia and America. There are about 200 kinds of monkey. Monkeys eat meat, leaves, fruit and even eggs!

entry.title: My school day
entry.content:
ğŸ“–My school day

This is my friend Alex, Greenall. He wants to share his school day with you.


        

        


ğŸ‘‹Hi! Iâ€™m Alex Greenall. Iâ€™m thirteen and I go to Park School in Oxford, England. I go to school on weekdays, but not on Saturday and Sunday. This is my school day. I get up at half past seven in the morning, and then have breakfast. 


My school is next to my house. I go to school at half past eight and see my friends. We start work at nine oâ€™clock. We have three lessons in the morning. My favourite subject is art. 


At eleven oâ€™clock, we have a break in the playground and I talk to my friends. They go to the playground and play football, but I donâ€™t like football. 


We have lunch in the dining hall at half past twelve. I like school lunch! We have meat and rice with vegetables, or hamburgers. I drink juice or water. 


We start lessons in the afternoon at half past one. We have two lessons in the afternoon. Then we go home at half past three. 


In the evening, I watch TV and have dinner with my family. I do my homework and go to bed at ten oâ€™clock. 


â€‹

entry.title: School Clubs
entry.content:
Today, we will learn about different clubs at Rosie Bridge school.
We will read an article about the Clubs Fair at this school.

Before we get started, letâ€™s read a poster. Please write the names of the clubs in the table.

the art club    the cooking club    the chess club    the coding club    the math club     the photography club    the rocket club    the robot club

Letters School Clubs
A
B
C
D
E
F
G
H

What clubs do you have at your school? Make a list. Which school club do you attend(å‚åŠ )?

Keys: the dancing club; the drama club; the calligraphy club (ä¹¦æ³•ç¤¾)

School Clubs and Activities

School Clubs Activities
the art club draw pictures
the cooking club cook delicious meals
the chess club play chess
the coding club make computer programs; build a website; make games
the math club math competitions; workshops on mathematical topics
the photography club teach members how to take photos, edit photos and learn software, such as photoshop.
the rocket club teach members how to build a rocket
the robot club teach members how to make a robot; learn programming languages; teach members how to use 3D printers

Pre-reading

Before you read, look at the picture and answer the questions below.

  1. What is the article about: family life or school life?
  2. How many clubs can you find in the picture?

Vocabulary

  1. At a fair, people let you ________ things.

    a. take  Â          b. look at or buy

  2. When you attend a class, you___________ it.
    a. leave  Â          b. go to have

  3. When a mum teaches her child to make a cake, she____.

    a. shows him/her how to do it    Â b. makes it for him/her

  4. If something disappears, _________.

    a. everyone can see it     b. no one can see it

  5. If something is amazing, it is very _________.

    a. good and surprising     b. bad and tiring

Blank-filling

Kelly is writing an email to Mandy. Complete her email with the words from the box.

another    attended    disappeared    surprised    teach

Dear Mandy,

Thanks for the email. My dad and I ______ the town fair last Friday. At the fair, my dad asked some farmers to ______ him how to grow vegetables. I played with some other children. Later, I couldnâ€™t find my favourite red jacket. It ___! I wanted to buy one. But a few minutes later, an old lady found it and gave it back to me! I was very ______ People in small towns are so nice! Do you have fairs like this in your country?
Best wishes,
Kelly

While-reading


        

           


Linda and Leo are new students at Rosie Bridge School. Last month, they attended the Clubs Fair.
First, Linda and Leo learnt about the Rocket Club.
â€œOur club will teach you how to build rockets. Then you can launch them into the sky,â€ a boy said. â€œWatch!â€
He took a rocket and launched it. The rocket disappeared into the sky. Linda and Leo were very surprised.
â€œWill it go all the way into space?â€ Linda asked.
â€œOf course it wonâ€™t,â€ a girl from another club shouted. â€œOur club is better. Come and join the Solar Power Club.â€
â€œWhat do you do?â€ asked Leo.
â€œWe make wonderful machines. They only use solar power. Look!â€ She took a toy car from the table and then used a remote control to drive it all around the playground.
â€œIt uses power from the Sun,â€ said Linda. â€œThatâ€™s amazing!â€
Linda and Leo learnt about many clubs. After the fair, they felt very excited.
â€œI want to join all the clubs,â€ said Linda.
â€œMe too!â€ said Leo.




Main Ideas
A Linda and Leo learnt about the Rocket Club     The Green Part


B Their feelings after visiting many clubs      The Blue Part


C Linda and Leo visited the Solar Power Club    The Orange Part


D Leo and Linda went to the Clubs Fair      Â The Grey Part


Comprehension
A. Read the blue part and choose the best answers.




First, Linda and Leo learnt about the Rocket Club.
â€œOur club will teach you how to build rockets. Then you can launch them into the sky,â€ a boy said. â€œWatch!â€
He took a rocket and launched it. The rocket disappeared into the sky. Linda and Leo were very surprised.
â€œWill it go all the way into space?â€ Linda asked.




    

  1. What can students do in the Rocket Club?
    

    A. learn to build rockets
    B. travel into space in rockets
    C. draw pictures of rockets
    D. launch rockets into the sky
    

    2. 

  2. How did Linda feel when they saw the rocket disappeared into the sky?
    

    A. Surprised.
    B. Excited.
    C. Frightened.
    D. Terrible.
    

    3. 



B. Read the orange part and decide if the following statements are true or false. 




â€œOf course it wonâ€™t,â€ a girl from another club shouted. â€œOur club is better. Come and join the Solar Power Club.â€
â€œWhat do you do?â€ asked Leo.
â€œWe make wonderful machines. They only use solar power. Look!â€ She took a toy car from the table and then used a remote control to drive it all around the playground.
â€œIt uses power from the Sun,â€ said Linda. â€œThatâ€™s amazing!â€




    

  1. The Solar Power Club teaches students to use solar power.
    2. 

  2. The girl used solar power to drive the car.
    3. 

  3. Solar power comes from the Sun.
    4. 



C. Read the grey part and answer the questions.




 Linda and Leo learnt about many clubs. After the fair, they felt very excited.
â€œI want to join all the clubs,â€ said Linda.
â€œMe too!â€ said Leo.




    

  1. How did they feel after the fair?
    2. 

  2. Can Linda and Leo join all the clubs?
    3. 



D. Find sentences from the article to go with these pictures.




















Post-reading
Read the following passages.


Welcome to our basketball. In our club, you will learn how to play basketball well. We teach you pulling skills and we do training on the school playground every afternoon. Whatâ€™s more, you will have the chance to play a match every month. I believe you will improve your basketball skills very quickly. Itâ€™s so much fun. Come and join us!


Welcome to English. In our club, you will learn how to improve your English. We have an English corner twice a week. Also, you will have the chance to listen to English speeches on Friday afternoons. I believe you will enjoy learning English if you join us. Itâ€™s so much fun.


Now imitate the articles above, and then write something to attract(å¸å¼•) students to join your club.
